intro: Hexalobus madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar starflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Hexalobus madagascariensis is adapted to the tropical and subtropical climates of its native habitat.
